fields.description: talk to Brendan about report content
implemented as a plugin - see spec.
move old stuff onto it
Move existing chart and search top level tabs under a single reports tab with sub-tabs for query, charts, and plugable reports (see other story)
filehistory page, changeset page, various left hand columns, ++
fields.summary: UI Integration time placeholder - Pete to create subtasks

fields.description: project list page needed aswell

Similar to a changelog or user page - activity stream and appropriate info as it becomes available. Note: it's just a page, there will be no decending in the hierarchy within the project (at least not until people start asking for it). Including loc chart and stats box etc
make sure it shows in fisheye

fields.summary: db schema change to store proj info

fields.description: Note - all repo specific settings are inherited from the underlying repos, i.e. linkers.
fields.summary: Add a collection of "content roots" across one or more repositories.

fields.description: There really isn't that much legacy js left in use in FishEye. This task is to kill off remaining uses of prototype, behaviour and redundant utility classes. All our js should be jquery based and in the AJS.FE namespace.

fields.summary: new action to handle fetching / sorting

fields.description: default sorted by recent activity, with sort options by total commits, name and total loc. Should show at least one other stat lifetime reviews and/or comments. Should respect current directory. Think ohloh contributors page.
fields.summary: List of users at /users and committers at /committers/REPO

fields.description: year, month, current month colour coded calendar

fields.summary: Activity histograms commits vs hour of day and day of week

fields.description:
One per repo in the left hand pane of the root changelog page
A repo/dir/user/committer/project specific one for each of those pages.
Stacked when more than one source is available (e.g. two committers or two reps)
Chart is just a larger version with more details.
Total number when collapsed and say "To be reviewed", "Awaiting Approval", and "Out for Review" lists. Obviously IF Crucible.
fields.summary: Show personal review summary on user home page
Show open review count on user pages

fields.description:
Changing the user's email address that is stored in Crowed does not populate the details to Fisheye/Crucible via resync, causing email notification sent to old email address.
Related issue logged in StAC: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-1476
fields.summary: UserManager does not resync user details if the user already exists

for all pages that don't have a repo
This includes updating any urls on the page which include the path and have a given style
(Assume new HTML available)
fields.summary: Reload the "files pane" with ajax from a click in the "tree pane" and update the breadcrumbs

fields.description: if full tree is too expensive to render in one go
Generate a full tree that "opens" at the current dir for the new browse page. (Assume new HTML available)
fields.summary: Use a full tree to navigate the new browse page
make a tag / javascript function / standardise

fields.description: Just like the jira linker but for crucible

SVN initialscan does not create changeset index until end of scan, so the activity stream is empty until the very end of the scan.

Does P4 and CVS do this as well?
fields.summary: SVN initialscan does not create changeset index until end of scan

fields.description: Update the UI tag to retrieve long details (issue summary, description, status etc.) when the 'details' link is pressed on JIRA items in the activity stream.
fields.summary: Add ajaxy "long details" to JIRA items in the Activity Stream

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an administrator, I don't have the option to globally apply default profile settings.
Each user has to change the settings independently by [changing their user profile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/changing-your-user-profile-298976815.html].

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the possibility for an administrator to set global default value that are applied to all users.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to globally apply default profile settings, so that every user gets the same user experience

fields.description:
currently, the mapping occurs from the point of view of jira project keys. this is inconsistent with how fisheye linkers view the world - they see it from the point of view of repository and cru projects. 

refactor the mappings of jira server defaults so that it is more repository centric - i.e., choose which repository should have what jira keys as defaults. 

also, refactor the storage of the defaults to be more repository centric (e.g., 
{code}
<jira-mapping-default>
<repositories>
<repository name="rep1">
<jira-keys>
<jira-key>CONF</jira-key>
<jira-key>AJS</jira-key>
</jira-keys>
</repository>
</repositories> 
</jira-mapping-default>
{code}
fields.summary: make repository and crucible defaults for jira issues that are not mapped redux

fields.description: Currently, after changing the poll period value, you will need to restart fisheye. It would be easier if the updater thread can reflect the value instantly without restarting a repo/server.
fields.summary: Server/Repo restart is not required after changing the poll period value

fields.description: placeholder
fields.summary: View a list of reps at /browse

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20090224-caxupcwx6gyywb6wgcuqnupcip.png!
fields.summary: Links from quicknav don't include the context path
make repository and crucible defaults for jira issues that are not mapped

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) In your browser get the auth token
e.g 
[http://speculator:8060/api/rest/login?username=partha&password=partha] 

this should return you an auth token like 
{noformat}
partha:46:a2f7ee24c7015f99faa1f1c867331b9b&
{noformat}

2) Run a query via the remote api to get the details of a review 

[http://speculator:8060/api/rest/query?rep=xwiki&query=select+revisions+where+csid=16956+return+author,reviews&auth=partha:46:a2f7ee24c7015f99faa1f1c867331b9b&]

You will get results like:

{code:xml}
<response><row><author>asiri</author><reviews>
<review>
<id>CR-21</id></review>
</reviews>
</row>
<row><author>asiri</author><reviews>
<review>
<id>CR-21</id></review>
</reviews>
</row>
<row><author>asiri</author><reviews>
<review>
<id>CR-21</id></review>
</reviews>
</row>
...
{code}

However this is not the complete results. 

3) Log into the the server, i.e. go to 

[http://speculator:8060/] and log in as partha/partha

4) Then run the query again:

[http://speculator:8060/api/rest/query?rep=xwiki&query=select+revisions+where+csid=16956+return+author,reviews&auth=partha:46:a2f7ee24c7015f99faa1f1c867331b9b&]

This time you should get results like 
{code:xml}
<response><row><author>asiri</author><reviews>
<review>
<id>CR-21</id><title>Merged from trunk (rev. 16937)</title><description>16956: Merged from trunk (rev. 16937)</description><state>Review</state><isDraft>false</isDraft><isOpen>true</isOpen><isClosed>false</isClosed></review>
</reviews>
</row>
<row><author>asiri</author><reviews>
<review>
<id>CR-21</id><title>Merged from trunk (rev. 16937)</title><description>16956: Merged from trunk (rev. 16937)</description><state>Review</state><isDraft>false</isDraft><isOpen>true</isOpen><isClosed>false</isClosed></review>
</reviews>
</row>
<row><author>asiri</author><reviews>
<review>
<id>CR-21</id><title>Merged from trunk (rev. 16937)</title><description>16956: Merged from trunk (rev. 16937)</description><state>Review</state><isDraft>false</isDraft><isOpen>true</isOpen><isClosed>false</isClosed></review>
</reviews>
</row>
{code}


This is because even though you are passing the  auth token, fisheye does not pass this down when it delegates running the query. 

If instead you use FEAUTH rather than auth, then you get the full results, 

i.e. 

[http://speculator:8060/api/rest/query?rep=xwiki&query=select+revisions+where+csid=16956+return+author,reviews&FEAUTH=partha:46:a2f7ee24c7015f99faa1f1c867331b9b&]

as FEAUTH passes this login down when the query is run.
fields.summary: using the auth parameter not all review information is returned.
Apply JIRA mapping linkers to Crucible projects in a clever fashion

fields.description: When I do a quick search in FishEye, the results don't seem to be ordered. See the sample screen shot
probably seraph os_username & os_password params
fields.summary: Add explicit user authentication for JIRA Activity Items (alternative to trusted apps)

fields.description:
Trying to run EyeQL queries through the REST API

I tried the query (changelog) that is in the sample code and it worked.  I then substituted a number of other EyeQL queries from the EyeQL documentation, and got this error

java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 400 for URL: http://jopesadmin:8060/api/rest/select revisions from dir /
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown Source)
	at com.pragmatics.fisheye.connector.FishEyeConnectorTest.testConnection(FishEyeConnectorTest.java:45)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	...

This leads me to believe that either the documentation is wrong/incomplete or that your REST implementation may be lacking the functionality to actually call an EyeQL query.

Thank you
Liz Sommers
sommerse@pragmatics.com
fields.summary: Rest API does not run EyeQL queries correctly

fields.description: I'd like to be able to trigger a Fisheye rescan using the remote API instead of using the fisheye.ctl script.
fields.summary: Rescan method in the remote api

fields.description:
I haven't fixed the items below because I wasn't sure how to set up JIRA to test them:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-1221/#c11113
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-1221/#c11112

Our charts documentation:

[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Charts]

does not describe the charts in any detail. 

For example we should specify that the commit volume specifies the file revisions, i.e. a changeset that was committed which includes 40 files would add 40 to this commit volume (rather than add one for the commit).
fields.summary: Describe the fisheye charts in more details

fields.description:
In certain circumstances, the external user management used within fisheye/crucible may have a username with a new line character. This can break some ajax functionality such as the autocomplete feature when trying to select reviewers in a review. 

We should sanitise the usernames when importing them into fisheye.
fields.summary: We should check usernames for new line characters before importing them into fisheye

fields.description:
User was having a problem in viewing a same file (chinese GBK encoding) in both annotated view and diff view.

The chinese characters are being displayed correctly when the user view the file in annotated view, but not in diff view.
fields.summary: Different Chinese Encoded Characters in Annotated view & Diff view

fields.description:
Say I have a /BigProject top-level directory containing hundreds of thousands of files.  I now 'svn mv BigProject NewBigProject'.  Fisheye will take many hours to index this apparently simple change.

In the Subversion log this appears as a delete and an add:

Changed paths:
   D /BigProject
   A /NewBigProject (from /tags:2653)

I think Fisheye is treating these as discrete operations, and trying to generate a massive changeset containing every file.
fields.summary: Faster indexing of of directory moves

fields.description:
I'm sorry for the premature submit last time: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-1150.
I was assuming that I've had at least 1GiB asigned. I did not (SMF ignored my FISHEYE_OPTS).

Now, assigning more Memory (2GiB), does indeed solve half of the problem: I do not get into the Heap Space error. (With one GiB I had the heap space error AND the one below):

For one, the application chokes on a revision, because a file changed from being a file to being a directory (or vice versa), see below.

For the other: It still EATS CPU:

fields.description:
After we committed a new changes to existing file inside Perforce repository, the latest changeset says that it is "new" (instead of showing diff). This happens when we set the Start Revision after the last revision number. 

For example, sample.txt was committed as changeset revision 5 in previous. The Start Revision is being set as 10. After we committed sample.txt at this time (revision 20), it would show "new" for this sample.txt. As what was mentioned by user, "new" could be a misleading word (prefer "No History").

How to reproduce the issue:
# Add and commit 2-3 files into the Perforce repo (changeset rev 1 and rev 2).
# Make some changes to any of those files, and commit again (changeset rev 3).
# Goto Administration>REPO>Edit Details, set value 2 for Start Revision field.
# Goto Administration>REPO>Maintenance, click "Scan Now".
# Go to repository view, and look into the changeset details.
fields.summary: Existing committed file appears as New in Changeset Details

fields.description:

fisheye   7708  0.7  0.444207261968 ?        O 14:50:42  0:05 /opt/appsrv/java/bin/java -Dfisheye.library.path= -Dfisheye.inst=/var/bldserv/fisheye -Djava.awt.headless=true -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/opt/bldserv/fisheye-1.6.6/lib/endorsed -jar /opt/bldserv/fisheye-1.6.6/fisheyeboot.jar stop --config /opt/bldserv/conf/fisheye.xml

https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo?cs=74554

The username is {{svnsync}} but it should actually be {{bmccoy}}. Looking @ the changeset in IDEA seems to recognise it as bmccoy

fields.description:
e.g. where it currently renders "CR-123 is now in Summarize" it should say "Tim Pettersen is summarizing CR-123"

While you are there itemReviewStateChange.tag will also need access to the review for participants and description at least for some state changes.
fields.summary: State changes should include the user who caused the state change.

fields.description:
Hello,
 in studio we use quite often fisheye components that are not available to plugins, and we need to 'hack' into fisheye internals.

Here is a list (not complete) of places where we would like to have nice api. Please review these and either suggest a better way of accessing fisheye or introduce the api.

|| What || Where || Why ||
| FisheyeTrustedApplicationsManager | [FisheyeTrustedApplicationsSynchroniser|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/APL/trunk/applinks-fisheye-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/applinks/fisheye/trusted/FisheyeTrustedApplicationsSynchroniser.java] | Adding/removing trusted application |
| ProjectDataFactory, ProjectManager | [FisheyeLocalProjectCreator|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-fisheye-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/fisheye/api/FisheyeLocalProjectCreator.java] | Creating fisheye repository and Crucible project |
| FisheyeWebResourceManager | [ThemeFooterResourceHandler|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-fisheye-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/fisheye/theme/ThemeFooterResourceHandler.java] and [ThemeHeaderResourceHandler|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-fisheye-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/fisheye/theme/ThemeHeaderResourceHandler.java] and [footer|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-fisheye-plugin/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/studio/fisheye/theme/footer.vm] | Including web resources in velocity files to render studio header and footer |
| TxTemplate, ProjectManager | [UpgradeTo_v10|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-fisheye-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/fisheye/upgrade/UpgradeTo_v10.java] | Adding and removing project |
| AppConfig | in [this|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/SAL/trunk/sal-fisheye-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/sal/fisheye/appconfig] package | All sorts of uses |


Thank you

fields.summary: Print Stack Trace after exception in fisheye command line

fields.description:
Recently, we have a customer raised up an issue on syntax highlighting, particularly PHP file. I have replicated the issue and attached them.

In the first attachment, we can see that after first occurrence of syntax "$this->...", all the subsequent text has become black in color.

Also, I have attached second attachment on how suppose the syntax highlight should be. 

Thanks for your attention.
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-1146

fields.description:
Genereated from [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/The+FishEye+Remote+API?focusedCommentId=179444814#comment-179444814]. 

Some customers may want to return unique results of certain values (such as revision or author) rather a value per a file.
fields.summary: Add the ability to return unique results in EyeQL

fields.description:
We should be able to connect to ldap via ssl in fisheye though we do not provide instructions on how to do so. 

[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/LDAP+Authentication] 

We need to add these instructions.
fields.summary: Add guide on how to connect to LDAP over SSL instructions in the docs.
